statement.p: At 2:00 PM one day, Muffin and Rex were sleeping atop one another. A loud noise startled the animals and Muffin began to run due north at a constant rate of 1.7 while Rex ran due east at a constant rate of 2.1. The critters maintained these paths and rates for several seconds. Calculate the rate at which the distance between the cat and dog was changing three seconds into their run.

Schuyler's clock is kaput; the minute hand functions as it should but the hour hand is stuck at 4. The minute hand on the clock is 30 long and the hour hand is 10 long. Determine the rate of change between the tips of the hands every time the minute hand points directly at 12.

It was a dark night and 5.5 tall Bahram was walking towards a street lamp whose light was perched 40 into the air. As he walked, the light caused a shadow to fall behind Bahram. When Bahram was 80 from the base of the lamp he was walking at a pace of 2. At what rate was the length of Bahram's shadow changing at that instant? Make sure that each stated and calculated rate value has the correct sign. Make sure that your conclusion sentence clearly communicates whether the length of the shadow was increasing or decreasing at the indicated time.

The gravitational force, F, between two objects in space with masses m_1 and m_2 is given by the formula F=\frac{Gm_1m_2}{r^2} where r is the distance between the objects' centers of mass and G is the universal gravitational constant.

Two pieces of space junk, one with mass 500 and the other with mass 3000, were drifting directly toward one another. When the objects' centers of mass were 250 apart the lighter piece was moving at a rate of 0.5 and the heavier piece was moving at a rate of 0.9. Leaving G as a constant, determine the rate at which the gravitational force between the two objects was changing at that instant. Make sure that each stated and calculated rate value has the correct sign. Make sure that your conclusion sentence clearly communicates whether the force was increasing or decreasing at that given time. The unit for F is Newtons ().

An eighteen inch pendulum sitting atop a table is in the downward part of its motion. The pivot point for the pendulum is 30 above the table top. When the pendulum is 45 away from vertical, the angle formed at the pivot is decreasing at the rate of 25. At what rate is the end of the pendulum approaching the table top at this instant? Make sure that each stated and calculated rate value has the correct sign. Make sure that you use appropriate units when defining your variables.

hint.p: Draw a right triangle with one acute angle vertex at the pivot point and the other acute angle vertex at the end of the pendulum. The rate of change of one piece of this triangle is the same as the rate you are trying to find.
